summary: This document is an email chain from July 2020 regarding the custody arrangements for Ghislaine Maxwell at the Merrimack County Department of Corrections. It details strict security protocols and includes a request to add her New York attorneys to her approved contact list for legal calls.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was in custody at the Merrimack County Department of Corrections under extremely high-security protocols in July 2020.
Security directives included 24/7 SRT (Special Response Team) posting, a 15-minute observation watch, restricted staff communication, and daily download of surveillance footage.
Initially, only attorney Lawrence Vogelman was authorized for contact with Maxwell, requiring a PIN.
A request was made to also authorize her New York attorneys, Chris Everdell and Mark Cohen, for contact to discuss case strategy.
The document highlights the U.S. Marshals Service's control over Maxwell's communications and the highly restricted nature of her detention due to the high-profile status of the case.
